10

Connolly to run for mayor

City councilor John R. Connolly will declare today his mayoral candidacy, striving to topple Thomas M. Menino — who has not said publicly if he will seek a sixth term — to be Boston's first new chief executive in a generation.

Benedict to be called 'emeritus pope'

Once he's retired, Pope Benedict XVI will be known as "emeritus pope" and continue to wear a white cassock, the Vatican said. (7:12 a.m.)

Bill Brett’s Boston party photos

More than 300 guests attended the 17th Annual Oscar Night Gala Sunday night at the State Room in Boston.

Mass. home sales up 10% in January

With 2,680 single-family homes sold in Massachusetts last month, it was the state's best January since 2007, the Warren Group reported. (6:27 a.m.)

Feared budget cuts rooted in dysfunction

The potentially massive cuts in federal spending that could affect federal and state agencies was borne a year and a half ago as Washington’s own game of chicken.

Committee plan restricts school choice

A special committee proposed a new student-assignment system in Boston that lets more children attend school near home while still allowing an element of choice.

Cape Air names woman to lead airline

Linda Markham is poised to not only run one of the largest independent regional carriers in the US, but also to become the only female president of a North American airline — and one of just a few around the world.

Green Line trolley strikes car in Allston

An outbound B-line trolley on the MBTA's Green Line struck a car near the Pleasant Street stop in Allston shortly after 8 p.m. on Monday, authorities said.

Hot air balloon crash in Egypt kills group of foreigners

An Egyptian official says a fire and an explosion caused the crash into sugar cane fields near the ancient city of Luxor on Tuesday. The casualties included French, British, and other nationals.

5 tips for handling a declined credit card

Credit cards are declined for a variety of reasons. You may be over your credit limit. Your credit score may have dropped, or the credit card company may suspect that the card is being used fraudulently.
